Description: Body sherd of Chian black-figured Animal pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline and added red centre with two faded white bands below; exterior: black-figure (fired red) decoration consisting of bull (parts of neck, shoulder, body and legs remaining) to right; part of rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1886,0401.1070 and University College London, UCL 363.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 331, no. 1592)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1289) (phase 2)
